media:group.media:title: ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีจ ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีณีซึีกีถีถีฅึีซึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีถ ีกีฆีกีฟีฅีฌีธึ ีฐีกีดีกึ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟ ีง ีกีดีฅีถ ีฆีซีปีดีกีถ. ีีธึึีฅีถ ีีธึึีฅีถีตีกีถึ
media:group.media:description:
ีีกีทีซีถีฃีฟีธีถีธึีด ึ ึีฅึ ีฟึีกีฎ ีขีกีถีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ ีนีงีซีถ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีธึีถีฅีถีกีฌ ีฌีธึึีป ีกึีคีตีธึีถึีถีฅึ: ิฑีี-ีจ ึีธึีดีกีฌ ีกีผีธึีดีธีพ ีกีถีฃีกีด ีดีซีปีถีธึีคีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถีกีฟีพีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีนีงึ ีฝีฟีกีถีฑีถีฅีฌ. ีฐีกึีฉีกีฏ ีงึ ีฟึีกีดีกีคึีฅีฌ, ีถีทีธึีด ีง ยซิดีฅีดีธีฏึีกีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีกีตีฌีจีถีฟึีกีถึยป ีฏีธึีฝีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ีีธึึีฅีถ ีีธึึีฅีถีตีกีถึีจ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิฑึีทีกีฌีธึีตีฝ ีีฒีคีฅีฝีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด: ีีตีธึีฝ ีฏีธีฒีดีซึ, ีถึีก ีญีธีฝึีธีพ, ีกีตีค ีขีกีถีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ ีนีงีซีถ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีธึีถีฅีถีกีฌ ีฏีธีถีฏึีฅีฟ ีกึีคีตีธึีถึ, ึีกีถีซ ีธึ ีคึีกีถึ ีนีงึ ีดีกีฝีถีกีฏึีธึีด ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ, ีธึีจ ีธีน ีดีซีกีตีถ ีฐีกีต-ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีฃีฌีญีกีพีธึ ีดีซีปีถีธึีคีถีฅึีซึ ีดีฅีฏีถ ีง, ีกีตีฌึ, ีจีฝีฟ ีงีธึีฉีตีกีถ, ีฐีกีฏีกีดีกึีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกีฟีดีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีกีฝ ีง, ีคึีก ีฏีธีฒีดีฅึีซึ ีดีฅีฏีจ: ีีธึึีฅีถีตีกีถึีซ ีฏีกึีฎีซึีธีพี ีีซีฏีธีฌ ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีจ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ ีีธึีฝีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีณีซึีกีถีถีฅึีซึ ีกีฆีกีฟีฅีฌีธึ ีฐีกีดีกึ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟ ีง ีกีดีฅีถ ีฆีซีปีดีกีถ:
0:00 - ิฒีกีถีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ ีีกีทีซีถีฃีฟีธีถีธึีด` ีกีผีกีถึ ีฌีธึึีป ีฑีฅีผีขีฅึีธึีดีถีฅึีซ 3:58 - ิปีีถีน ีฐีกึึีฅึ ีฅีถ ีคึีพีกีฎ ีขีกีถีกีฏึีกีตีซีถ ีฝีฅีฒีกีถีซีถ 6:35 - ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีฐีซีดีถีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีฐีกีถีปีถีฅึีจ ีพีฅึีกีขีฅึีฅีฌีซ ีฅีถ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซีถ 8:25 - ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีถ ีธึ ิฑีฌีซึีถ ีงีฌ ีนีฅีถ ีฑีฃีฟีธึีด ีญีกีฒีกีฒีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีฃึีซ ีฝีฟีธึีกีฃึีดีกีถ 10:29 - ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีถ ีซีฝีฏีกีบีฅีฝ ีพีกีญีฅีถีธีึีด ีง ีฐีกีถึีกีตีซีถ ีจีถีคีพีฆีธึีดีซึ 16:11 - ิฒีกีถีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ ิฒึีตีธึีฝีฅีฌีธึีด. ิฑึึีดีธึีฟึีซ ีซึีกีฏีกีถ ีถีบีกีฟีกีฏีถีฅึีจ 20:48 - ีีซีทีฟ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีคีฅีบึีธึีด ิฑึึีกีญีซ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีซีถึีถีกีพีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถ ีซึีกีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีง 26:11 - ีีธึีดีกีถีซีฟีกึ ีซีถีฟีฅึีพีฅีถึีซีก ิฑึึีกีญ ิฟีธีฝีธีพีธีตีซ ึ ึีซีถีกีฏีธีพ ีกีถีฐีถีกึ ีง 27:16 - ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีจ ีญีถีคีซึ ีง ีคึีฅีฌ ีฐีฅีผีกีถีกีีฌ ีิด-ีซึ

entry.title: โICC membership has a deterrence role,โ says former court chief

media:group.media:title: โICC membership has a deterrence role,โ says former court chief
media:group.media:description:
In the aftermath of the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war, Armenian legal teams have been working to find new ways to hold Azerbaijan accountable for abuse and war crimes committed against Armenian servicemen and civilians. The Center for Truth and Justice is one such organization. Its team of lawyers have overseen the collection of testimonial evidence and created a database that can now be accessed by interested legal teams. CivilNet caught up with the CFTJ team, who just wrapped up their second annual conference at the American University of Armenia. This yearโs keynote speaker was Judge Chile Eboe-Osuji, the former head of the International Criminal Court. Judge Eboe-Osuji explains to us what exactly becoming a full member of the ICC would mean for Armenia.

media:group.media:title: ีีกีต ีฌีซีถีฅีฌีจ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีฅึึีธึีตีฉ ีง ินีธึึึีซีกีตีธึีด
media:group.media:description:
ีีกีต ีฌีซีถีฅีฌีถ ีกึีคีฅีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีฅึึีธึีตีฉ ีง ินีธึึึีซีกีตีธึีด` ีกีถีฏีกีญ ีถึีกีถีซึ, ีฉีฅ ีฐีกีต ีฐีกีดีกีตีถึีจ ีธึีนีกึ ีถีฅึีฃึีกีพีพีกีฎ ึ/ีฏีกีด ีกีฆีคีฅึีซีฏ ีง ีฅึีฏึีซ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีฃีธึีฎีจีถีฉีกึีถีฅึีธึีด, ีถีทีธึีด ีง ยซิฑึีกีฝยป ีฐึีกีฟีกึีกีฏีนีกีฟีกีถ ีฃีฌีญีกีพีธึ ีญีดีขีกีฃีซึ ีีธีขีฅึ ีีธึีฉีกีทีจ: ีีก ีกีฝีธึีด ีง, ีธึ ินีธึึึีซีกีตีธึีด ีกีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ีบีกีฟีฏีกีถีฅีฌีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีกึึีจ ีฏีกึึีธึ ีง ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีดีถีฅึีธึีด: ีีธีขีฅึ ีีธึีฉีกีทีจ ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีถีธึีด ีง ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีฟีกึีขีฅึ ีฏีธึีฝีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีธึีด, ีกีตีค ีฉีพีธึีดี ีีฅีปีฅึ ินีกีตีซึ ิทึีคีธีฒีกีถีซ ีฏีธึีฝีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีธึีด ีฐีกีตีฅึีซ ีถีฅึีฃึีกีพีพีกีฎีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีญีถีคีซึีจ:

media:group.media:description:
In this weekโs edition of CivilNetโs business digest:
๐Lengthy delays at the border crossing between Georgia and Russia, reportedly due to malfunctioning X-ray machines, are expected to be reduced in the coming days. ๐Money transfers to Armenian banks by individuals outside the country nearly tripled year-on-year in the first quarter, hitting more than $1.5 billion. ๐Armeniaโs Central Bank decided to keep its key refinancing rate unchanged, at 10.75%, as inflation in the country continues to ease from last yearโs peak. ๐Upwards of $760 million in taxes flowed into Armeniaโs state coffers in April, marking a new record for the countryโs highest tax collection rate in a single month.

entry.title: Pashinyan to head to Moscow as Armenia-Azerbaijan talks conclude in US

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan to head to Moscow as Armenia-Azerbaijan talks conclude in US
media:group.media:description:
๐After multiday peace talks in the United States between delegations from Armenia and Azerbaijan, the two countriesโ foreign ministries released identical statements noting that their positions on a number of key issues remain distant. ๐Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, currently in Prague on an official visit, announced that he will travel to Moscow next week. ๐Armenian Parliamentary Speaker Alen Simonyan discussed Turkeyโs move to close its airspace to Armenian airliners at a meeting with his Turkish counterpart in Ankara. ๐Nagorno-Karabakhโs Sarsang reservoir, its largest, has almost dried up due to hydropower overuse prompted by Azerbaijanโs ongoing blockade of the Lachin corridor.

entry.title: ิฟึีฏีถีกีฏีซ ีทึีปีกึีกีฏีธึีดีจ, ยซีีีน ีงีฉีถีซีฏ ีฆีฟีดีกีถีจยป ึ ีีกีดีพีฅีฌ ิฒีกีขีกีตีกีถีซ ีดีกึีคีกีทีกีฟ ีฐีกีถีคีซีบีธึีดีถีฅึีจโค ิฑึึีกีญีถ ีกีตีฝ ีทีกีขีกีฉ

media:group.media:title: ิฟึีฏีถีกีฏีซ ีทึีปีกึีกีฏีธึีดีจ, ยซีีีน ีงีฉีถีซีฏ ีฆีฟีดีกีถีจยป ึ ีีกีดีพีฅีฌ ิฒีกีขีกีตีกีถีซ ีดีกึีคีกีทีกีฟ ีฐีกีถีคีซีบีธึีดีถีฅึีจโค ิฑึึีกีญีถ ีกีตีฝ ีทีกีขีกีฉ
media:group.media:description:
๐ิฑีบึีซีฌีซ 23-ีซึ ิฑึึีกีญีจ ีฐีกีตีฟีถีพีฅีฌ ีง ีฏึีฏีถีกีฏีซ ีทึีปีกึีกีฏีดีกีถ ีดีฅีปึ ีีกีฏีกึีซีซ ีฏีกีดึีปีซ ีพึีก ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถึีซีถีฅึีจ ีกีบึ ึีซีถีซ ีกีถึีกีฏีฅีฟ ีฅีถ ีคึีฅีฌ, ีธึีซ ีคีฅีด ีกีผีกีตีชีด ีธีนีซีถีน ีนีฅีถ ีฏีกึีธีฒีกีถีธึีด ีกีถีฅีฌ ีผีธึีฝ ีญีกีฒีกีฒีกีบีกีฐีถีฅึีจึ ีีกีตีฅึีจ ีฝีบีกีฝีธึีด ีฅีถ ีผีธึีฝ ีญีกีฒีกีฒีกีบีกีฐ ีฆีธึีกีฏีกีฆีดีซ ีถีธึีกีถีทีกีถีกีฏ ีฐึีกีดีกีถีกีฟีกึ, ีฃีฅีถีฅึีกีฌ-ีฃีถีคีกีบีฅีฟ ิผีฅีถึีธีพีซ ีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถีซีถ, ีธึีจ ีบีซีฟีซ ีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถ ีขีฅึีซ ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีฒีดีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีขีกีถีกีฏึีฅีฌีธึึ ีฐีฅีฟีธึ ๐ิฑึึีกีญีธึีด ีฉีกึ ีง ีฐีกีพีกึีธึีด ีฅึีฏีธึ ีกีฏึีซีกี ยซีีี ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีงีฉีถีซีฏ ีฆีฟีดีกีถีจยป ีทีกึีชีธึีดีจ ึ ีีกีดีพีฅีฌ ิฒีกีขีกีตีกีถีซ ีฐีกีถีคีซีบีธึีดีถีฅึีจ ีขีถีกีฏีซีนีถีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟึ ีีธึีฝีกีฐีกีฟีพีกีฎ ิฑึึีกีญีธึีด ิฒีกีขีกีตีกีถีซีถ ีทีกีฟีฅึีจ ีฟีฅีฝีถีธึีด ีฅีถ ีธึีบีฅีฝ ีพีฅึีปีซีถ ีฐีธึีตีฝ, ีธึีจ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีง ีดีซ ีขีกีถ ึีธีญีฅีฌึ ๐ีีกีขีกีฉีพีก ีพีฅึีปีซีถ ีดีฅีถึ ีถีกึ ีกีตึีฅีฌีฅึีซีถึ ีีกึีฝีกีถีฃีซ ีปึีกีดีขีกึึ ิทีถีฅึีฃีฅีฟีซีฏ ีณีฃีถีกีชีกีดีจ ิฑึึีกีญีธึีด ีญีธึีกีถีธึีด ีงึ

entry.title: Do Pashinyanโs predecessors share the responsibility for the 2020 war defeat?

media:group.media:title: Do Pashinyanโs predecessors share the responsibility for the 2020 war defeat?
media:group.media:description:
Armeniaโs former education minister and Republican Party member, Armen Ashotyan, sat down with CivilNet to reflect on the 5th anniversary of the 2018 Velvet Revolution, which catapulted Nikol Pashinyan to power. Ashotyan discussed Pashinyanโs predecessors' share of responsibility for Armeniaโs defeat in the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war, if the revolution was really non-violent and why opinion polls continue to show Pashinyanโs Civil Contract having a wide lead over all other political parties in the country.
